attributes.action: Educational Practitioners To Work Remotely At Least One Day A Week During COVID
attributes.additional_details: During the national pandemic, educational practitioners are under pressure to encourage and monitor the progress of both pupils learning remotely and those who are present in school as a result of their parents/carers being key/critical workers. As educational practitioners, we are now expected to teach in class all day but further go on to provide feedback to pupils remotely learning throughout the day - we need further time for planning, preparation and assessment.
attributes.background: To allow educational practitioners to work remotely at least one day a week during the national lockdown to be able to manage the responsibilities of teaching both in the class and monitoring online learning.

rejection.details:
Staffing decisions, including whether or not teachers can work from home, are for individual schools as employers, not the UK Government or Parliament. 

You could start a new petition calling for schools to only be allowed to open for a maximum of four in-person school days per week during the pandemic, if that's something that you'd like to happen.
